page.title: 12Transport in Steeple Claydon
page.content: Transport is particularly important in Steeple Claydon because it is so {isolated.}A large proportion of the population is elderly or very young and,as the nearest general{hospital}is 17 miles away,transport can be a real problem. Consequently 72% of the population use a car while only 23% use{public {transport.}However when specifically asked,70% said they would use public transport if it were available.This is important in view of the cuts due to be implemented in the public transport sector. There are daily workers' buses to Aylesbury and Buckingham.A bus goes to Buckingham on Tuesdays and Saturdays. One goes to Bicester daily.On Tuesdays there is a bus to Milton Keynes while Tesco provides a free bus on Tuedays to its Hypermarket in Aylesbury.
